pull.title: convert C-style (void) parameter lists to C++ style ()
pull.body:
In C, an empty parameter list, `()`, means the function takes any arguments, and `(void)` means the function does not take any parameters.
In C++, an empty parameter list means the function does not take any parameters.

So, C++ still supports `(void)` parameter lists with the same semantics, why change to `()`?

1. removing the redundant `void` improves signal-to-noise ratio of the code
2. using `(void)` exposes a rare inconsistency in that a template taking a template `(T)` parameter list, cannot be instantiated with `T=void`

events.message: convert C-style (void) parameter lists to C++ style ()

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14267 (gui: Mark Qt methods as override where appropriate by Empact)
* #14224 (Add -fsanitize=integer Travis job. Document intentional and unintentional unsigned integer overflows (wraparounds) using annotations. by practicalswift)
* #13864 (validation: Document where we are intentionally ignoring bool return values from validation related functions by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I compiled with clang and the code change doesn't change a single bit of the `bitcoind` binary. (Didn't check `test_bitcoin` and `bitcoin-qt`)

issue.title: validation: Document where we are intentionally ignoring bool return values from validation related functions
issue.body:
* Document where we are intentionally ignoring the return value from `bool` returning functions from `validation.{cpp,h}` that modify state
* Mark validation functions whose `bool` return value should not be discarded in the general case with `NODISCARD` (expands to `[[nodiscard]]` or `__attribute__((warn_unused_result))` depending on availability)

This will help us identify code where we're we incorrectly assume that a certain function always succeeds in performing its state modification.

events.body:
utACK 3ccfa34

Nice cleanup indeed. 

[NL.25: Don’t use void as an argument type](http://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#nl25-dont-use-void-as-an-argument-type) "*It’s verbose and only needed where C compatibility matters.*"

As a nit, maybe replace the `void ()` instances with `void()` in `scheduler`.

issue.title: Document intentional and unintentional unsigned integer overflows (wraparounds) using annotations
issue.body:
* ~~Add `-fsanitize=integer` Travis job~~
* Document unsigned integer overflows (wraparounds) using annotation `ALLOW_WRAPAROUND` (intentional) or `WARNING_UNINTENTIONAL_WRAPAROUND` (unintentional).

issue.title: gui: Mark Qt methods as override where appropriate
issue.body: As the underlying methods are virtual, and this ensures they'll continue to play that role.

issue.title: Convert C-style (void) parameter lists to C++ style () (merge from bitcoin)
issue.body:
Merge from bitcoin: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14214

Convert C-style (void) parameter lists to C++ style ()

3ccfa34b32 convert C-style (void) parameter lists to C++ style () (Arvid Norberg)

Pull request description:

  In C, an empty parameter list, `()`, means the function takes any arguments, and `(void)` means the function does not take any parameters.
  In C++, an empty parameter list means the function does not take any parameters.

  So, C++ still supports `(void)` parameter lists with the same semantics, why change to `()`?

  1. removing the redundant `void` improves signal-to-noise ratio of the code
  2. using `(void)` exposes a rare inconsistency in that a template taking a template `(T)` parameter list, cannot be instantiated with `T=void`

Additionally, a few more occurrences in paicoin have been converted apart from the ones from the above bitcoin PR.

Signed-off-by: dartdart26 <29689712+dartdart26@users.noreply.github.com>
